item.title: Key Sounds
item.description:
There are 40 key sounds, or phonemes, taught in the Montessori early childhood classroom. 24 are represented by one symbol and 16 by a double symbol.

The three period lesson is used to introduce and practice these sounds with the sandpaper letters.

item.title: The Three Period Lesson
item.description: The three period lesson is an integral part of the Montessori curriculum. This lesson was originated by Edouard Seguin during the mid-19th century in France. The three period lesson is used in the 3-6 classroom to help children learn a variety of vocabulary including color names, numeral names, sandpaper letter sounds, and sight words.
